roleset.name: go down, cause to fall
roleset.note: DROP_V NOTES: Frames file for 'drop' based on survey of initial sentences from big corpus and comparison with 'fall'. VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls calibratable_cos-45.6, meander-47.7, put_direction-9.4, roll-51.3.1. (from the former drop-v.01)
DROP-N NOTES: Added by Julia. Member of Vncls calibratable_cos-45.6, meander-47.7, put_direction-9.4, roll-51.3.1. (from the former drop-n.01)
DROPPING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on drop.01. Corresponds to VNcls calibratable_cos-45.6-1, meander-47.7, put_direction-9.4, roll-51.3.1. (from the former dropping-n.01)

role.descr: end point, end state of arg1
attribute of arg1 actually falling, if separate from arg1

example.name: drop-v: start and end points
example.text: The government's borrowing authority dropped to $2.8 trillion from $2.87 trillion.

example.name: drop-v: extent
example.text: The stock market dropped nearly 7% Oct 13.

example.name: drop-v: manner
example.text: Yields on savings-type certificates of deposit dropped slightly last week.
example.arg: Yields on savings-type certificates of deposit

example.name: drop-v: agentive
example.text: John dropped a penny from the top of the Empire State Building.
example.arg: from the top of the Empire State Building

example.name: drop-v: with medium, argM-LOC
example.text: Oil dropped in price.

example.name: drop-n
example.text: a 26 % drop in profit , to $ 86.3 million

example.name: drop-n
example.text: Oil's drop in price

example.name: drop-n
example.text: And, if a diver at a greater depth is not neutrally buoyant, his dropping a weight belt may not lead to his ascent.

roleset.name: remove, end
roleset.note: DROP-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls fire-10.10. (from the former drop-v.05)
DROP-N NOTES: Added by Julia. Member of Vncls fire-10.10. (from the former drop-n.02)
DROPPING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on drop.01. Corresponds to VNcls calibratable_cos-45.6-1, meander-47.7, put_direction-9.4, roll-51.3.1. (from the former dropping-n.05)

example.name: drop-v: all args
example.text: Mr. Koch already has announced he will drop 3,200 jobs from the city payroll, but that won't be enough.

example.name: drop-v: no source
example.text: It has dropped its long-standing opposition.

example.name: drop-v: oddly also with new preference
example.text: ``The World Series, seven nights, wasn't enough of an incentive,'' says Arnold Klinsky of WHEC-TV in Rochester, which [*T*-1] dropped CBS for NBC six weeks ago.

example.name: drop-v: weight loss
example.text: ``I don't trust people who don't eat,'' said Ms. Volokh, though [she herself]-3 stopped eating lunch a few years ago [*-3] to drop 25 pounds.

example.name: drop-n
example.text: its drop from the lineup has been much lamented.

example.name: dropping-n
example.text: Smith said the offer depends on his dropping a countersuit.

example.name: dropping-n
example.text: A big reason for Bowers breakout was his dropping 20 pounds in the offseason.

roleset.name: give, esp. names, mention in an offhand way
roleset.note: DROP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on PB drop-v.06. (from the former drop-n.03)
DROPPING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, drop.06. No VNcls. (from the former dropping-n.06)

roles.note: No instances containing a hearer observed, but they seem possible. Arg2 could be added if it comes up.

example.name: drop-v: not much variation in syntax
example.text: Some people must drop names -- call it an irresistible impulse.

example.name: drop-v: Give a visit
example.text: I found 0 I had come to the riverbank , and thought 0 I might go and drop a visit to Uncle Baocheng .

example.name: drop-n
example.text: Today, we're witnessing the mass hysteria of Robert Pattinson fever, with teenage girls from around the world sobbing and shrieking at the drop of his name

example.name: drop-n
example.text: We speak at the drop of a hint that there is someone who will listen.
example.arg: of a hint that there is someone who will listen

roleset.name: spend money
roleset.note: DROPPING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on drop.07. (from the former dropping-n.07)

example.name: drop-v: big spender
example.text: They'd actually left the Soviet Union with $480, but during a stop in Italy Ms. Volokh dropped $80 on a black velvet suit.

example.name: dropping-n
example.text: his dropping a grand on his computer made him feel broke.

roleset.name: coming for a short visit
roleset.note: DROPPING-N NOTES: Added by Julia. based on drop.02. No corresponding VNcls. (from the former dropping-n.02)

example.name: drop_by-v: and bring the kids
example.text: Maybe she could drop by at the Metropolitan Opera.

example.name: drop_by-v: NP end point
example.text: You may drop by the VOA office in Washington.

example.name: dropping_by-n
example.text: The thing that I remembered best about my father was his dropping by in my younger years to whip me for being so bad.
example.arg: to whip me for being so bad

roleset.name: leave behind?
roleset.note: DROP-V NOTES: roles are same as above, except don't expect to see start point (from the former drop-v.03)
DROPPING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on drop.03. No VNcls. (from the former dropping-n.03)

example.name: drop_off-v: end point
example.text: John dropped his kids off at summer camp.

example.name: drop_off-v: intransitive
example.text: John dropped off (to sleep)

example.name: dropping_off-n
example.text: He does not take no for an answer, so you are intimidated into agreeing to his dropping off the goods at a location of his choice
example.arg: at a location of his choice

roleset.name: quit
roleset.note: DROP-V NOTES: Also in intransitive. (from the former drop-v.04)
DROPPING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on drop.04. No VNcls. (from the former dropping-n.04)

example.name: drop_out-v: flunk
example.text: John dropped out of school.

example.name: dropping-out-n
example.text: It's unfortunate that money is the factor in his dropping out of the race

example.name: drop_in-n: LVB
example.text: Maybe I will do a walk by drop in .
